      • build

        public MonteCarloSearch build()
        Returns:
        A new MonteCarloSearch instance.

      • setNumSimulations

        public MonteCarloSearch.Builder setNumSimulations(int numSimulations)
        Parameters:
        numSimulations - Number of simulations to run before picking the best action from the root node. In asynchronous mode, this represents the MAXIMUM number of simulations that will be run. Default value: 100000.
        Returns:
        this.

      • setDiscountRate

        public MonteCarloSearch.Builder setDiscountRate(double discountRate)
        Parameters:
        discountRate - The rate at which rewards should be discounted in the future, used to compute the present value of future rewards. This way, rewards further in the future are worth less. This captures our uncertainty about the future, as well as helping avoid infinite reward cycles, etc. Default value: 1.0 (no discounting).
        Returns:
        this.

      • setMaxDepth

        public MonteCarloSearch.Builder setMaxDepth(int maxDepth)
        Parameters:
        maxDepth - The maximum depth the search to in the simulation. Default value: 500.
        Returns:
        this.

      • setEvaluator

        public MonteCarloSearch.Builder setEvaluator(Evaluator evaluator)
        Parameters:
        evaluator - Function to use to evaluate the heuristic value of a terminal search node. Default value: WinLossEvaluator.
        Returns:
        this.
